```{python}
#| label: disease-deaths-vs-historical-events-chart
#| fig-cap: "A Tale of Two Tragedies: Daily Disease Deaths vs. 9/11"

import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add project root to path
project_root = Path.cwd()
while project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health' and project_root.parent != project_root:
    project_root = project_root.parent
sys.path.insert(0, str(project_root))

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from brain.figures._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_BLACK, COLOR_RED, COLOR_BLUE, COLOR_WHITE
)

# Setup styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Data
daily_disease_deaths = 150671
september_11_deaths = 2977

categories = ['Daily Disease\nDeaths', '9/11 Attacks\n(Total Deaths)']
values = [daily_disease_deaths, september_11_deaths]

# Create figure
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 12))

# Bar for Daily Disease Deaths (RED)
ax.bar(0, values[0], color=COLOR_RED, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3, width=0.8)
ax.text(0, values[0] * 0.5, f'{values[0]:,}', ha='center', va='center',
        fontsize=96, weight='bold', color=COLOR_WHITE)

# Bar for 9/11 Deaths (BLUE)
ax.bar(1, values[1], color=COLOR_BLUE, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3, width=0.8)
ax.text(1, values[1] + (values[0] * 0.02), f'{values[1]:,}', ha='center', va='bottom',
        fontsize=44, weight='bold', color=COLOR_BLACK)

# Set category labels
ax.set_xticks(np.arange(len(categories)))
ax.set_xticklabels(categories, fontsize=36, weight='bold', color=COLOR_BLACK)
ax.tick_params(axis='x', which='major', pad=20)

# Remove y-axis labels and spines
ax.set_yticks([])
ax.set_yticklabels([])
clean_spines(ax, ['top', 'right', 'left', 'bottom'])

# Add branding
add_watermark(fig)

# Save figure
output_dir = project_root / 'brain' / 'figures'
output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
plt.savefig(output_dir / 'disease-deaths-vs-historical-events-chart.png', dpi=150, bbox_inches='tight', facecolor=COLOR_WHITE)
plt.show()
```
